answers.answer: Call your ob. Some swelling is normal but to much can indicate a problem. Your ob may want to order a 24 or 48 hour urin studies. They are not bad you just collect your urin for 24 hours then the check it for possible protiens. Your doctor can order the study over the phone.

I may call her in the am. I don't want to worry over nothing and live quite a ways from my hospital. It's not been extreme swelling. I know a girl that had to have her baby at 33 weeks due to preeclamspie and I worries me a bit.
I wouldn't wait until the morning because that is signs of preeclampsia I would call right now or get to the er

Definitely check in with your OB. How have your blood pressures been? The swelling is normal to an extent but the blurred vision may indicate something else. There are labs that they can run. Most likely they'll be looking for preeclampsia.

It's not bad swelling but enough for me to notice. I drunk extra water tonight in case I was a little dehydrated which would always cause my vision to be a lil blurry. My swelling in my face goes down through out the day.

My blood pressure is always perfect each time I go to my appointment  (I'm going every 2 weeks now) I don't have a home blood pressure checker. Are the ones they have at stores you stick your arm in any good? They also check my urine each visit and they have never raised any concerns over it.

So I checked my blood pressure at  self check stand in kmart and it was in the normal range. I also called my doctor and they told me that some swelling while pregnant is normal... my feet were swollen worse then ever today and my hands were swollen along with my eye lids being puffy. I'm not to happy with the nurses answer but I'm thankful I have a doctor appt friday.

question: Hi, I'm 30w pregnant. I've had swelling in my feet for the last few weeks which I know is normal. Recently my fingers have started to swell and my face swells. Even though they swell it's not huge swelling, enough for me to notice though. This morning I woke up and my eye lids were pretty swollen and my vision has been a lil blurry today. Which I've had a history of blurry before getting pregnant if I hadn't drunk enough water. I Have been drinking alot of water while pregnant. I have a doctor appointment friday and am going to bring up my concerns. Just wondering what you all thought.
title: Normal or not?
